title: Database Administrator (MongoDB & Apache Cassandra)
description:
Zipdev is looking for a DBA for our client, who is a leading Compliance Software company dedicated to being the most trusted software in the Petroleum Industry.¬†

Responsibilities:

  • Manage and administer MongoDB and Apache Cassandra databases, ensuring high availability, performance, and security.
  • Design, implement, and maintain database architectures to support the organization's applications and services.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and optimize database performance.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot database issues, ensuring timely resolution and minimal downtime.
  • Implement and manage database backup and recovery processes.
  • Work on database optimization, including query performance tuning and index optimization.
  • Collaborate with developers to design efficient and scalable database schemas.
  • Implement and enforce security policies for database access and data integrity.
  • Stay informed about emerging trends and best practices in MongoDB and Apache Cassandra databases.

¬†

Requirements

  • Proven experience, from 3 to 5 years, as a Database Administrator, specifically with MongoDB and Apache Cassandra.
  • In-depth knowledge of database architecture, design, and optimization.
  • Experience with database performance tuning and troubleshooting.
  • Strong understanding of data security and privacy best practices.
  • Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Shell) for automation tasks.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and containerization (e.g., Docker).
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Certification in MongoDB or Apache Cassandra.
  • Experience with database migrations and upgrades.
  • Knowledge of NoSQL database technologies beyond MongoDB and Apache Cassandra.

Benefits

title: IT Operations Manager / DevOps (remote-only opportunity, location - Europe&CIS)
description:
We are looking for an IT Operations Manager to oversee a group of engineers who support our internal infrastructure, and employees‚Äô technical issues. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of DevOps methodology and be able to work autonomously and effectively in a remote environment. They should be able to help support their employees with development and training. This person should also be strategic by providing guidance as we scale up. 

CloudLinux is a global remote-first company. We are driven by our principles: Do the right thing, employees first, we are remote first, and  we deliver high volume, low-cost Linux infrastructure and security products that help companies to increase the efficiency of their operations. Every person on our team supports each other and does what we can to ensure everyone is successful. We are truly a great place to work. 

Become part of the team of experts and work with top-notch developers to contribute to open source. You can find more details about the project and the company on our branded websites at cloudlinux.com

What you will do:

  • Develop and lead a team of IT engineers that support our internal staff and global systems. 
  • Manage the infrastructure operations and lead the team of DevOps experts to manage the CloudLinux R&D tools (software, hardware, OS, peripherals).
  • Plan and budget the investment in CloudLinux internal delivery platform (hybrid environments)  to ensure effective software delivery and developer productivity.
  • Organize and prioritize work to ensure critical issues are being addressed in an acceptable timeframe and in compliance with internal SLA's.
  • Responsible for managing, planning, coordinating, and monitoring of Service functions, personnel, and software.
  • Manage the Jira system for tracking incidents, problems, change, assets, and knowledge base; addressing any issues; and making recommendations for improvement.
  • Maintain the security of the infrastructure at the level of certification requirements
  • Purchase efficient and cost-effective technological equipment and software. 
  • Communicate with the vendors, oversee the budget. 

Requirements:

To be successful you should have:

  • 5+ years of operational experience in R&D support and in IT Infrastructure.
  • 3+ years of IT management experience including communication with hardware vendors and data centers 
  • Deep understanding of DevOps methodology.
  • Deep understanding of supporting Linux platform (on premise and cloud)
  • R&D-focused, with an ability to understand and manage engineers expectations.

Benefits:

What's in it for you?

  • Interesting and challenging projects
  • Flexible working hours
